page.title: 02TOWNS AND VILLAGES
page.content:
Towns and villages still show the positions of ancient settlements. Originally they were found along the valley bottoms near to the flowing river, or perched along the ridges of the hills. The present situation follows a similar pattern.{Ripponden} and{Triangle}are found along the side of the River Ryburn. Norland Moor has the small village of{Norland}on the northern side, with{Barkisland}to the south, and Upper{Greetland}to the east.
The popularity of the area has grown since the{M62 motorway}was built. The road journey to Leeds or Bradford, or to Manchester, takes only about half an hour. New{housing}is causing the villages to spread towards one another. { }
